title: search generates a new id for an uninstalled dataset and thus reports two entries for it
body:
```
hopa:/tmp/123
$> datalad install ///     
2016-09-20 10:58:08,279 [INFO   ] Installing dataset at: /tmp/123/datasets.datalad.org (install.py:498)
1 installed item is available at
<Dataset path=/tmp/123/datasets.datalad.org>
(venv-tests) 2 19566.....................................:Tue 20 Sep 2016 10:58:08 AM EDT:.
hopa:/tmp/123
$> cd datasets.datalad.org 
crcns/  dicoms/  indi/  kaggle/  labs/  neurovault/  nidm/  openfmri/
(venv-tests) 2 19567.....................................:Tue 20 Sep 2016 10:58:11 AM EDT:.
(git)hopa:/tmp/123/datasets.datalad.org[master]
$> datalad search -r '*' DICOM
.:                            
 author: DataLad Team <team@datalad.org>
 contributors: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
 dc:conformsTo: http://docs.datalad.org/metadata.html#v0-1, http://specs.frictionlessdata.io/data-packages
 dc:hasPart: id=031991c8-7ed7-11e6-a607-002590f97d84, id=85c4465e-7aea-11e6-a5d5-002590f97d84, id=9183b182-7aea-11e6-8706-002590f97d84
 dc:isPartOf: 6d69ca68-7e85-11e6-904c-002590f97d84
 dc:modified: 2016-09-20T10:41:31-04:00
 homepage: http://datasets.datalad.org/?dir=/dicoms
 id: 5500090e-7aea-11e6-b268-002590f97d84
 keywords: DICOM, NeuroImaging
 license: http://opendatacommons.org/licenses/pddl/
 name: dicoms
 schema:availableFrom: id=940086d9-bff2-457d-9cf1-bebfa382ed33, id=f8cccf6e-59d8-4178-84f2-48fb328c9e78
 title: Various collections of DICOM files which could be used for software and methods testing
 type: Dataset
 version: 83ff4c3b0aeb3b75680bf3888d7ce12546450978
dicoms:
 id: 697128d0-7f42-11e6-97ff-8019340ce7f2
 location: dicoms
 type: Dataset
...
```

I thought it was because of some uninitialized id on remote site -- but nope... and that id it reports (updated dataset now), I can't find it anywhere ;)

``` shell
(git)hopa:/tmp/datasets.datalad.org[master]
$> datalad search -r '*' DICOM | head -20
.:
 author: DataLad Team <team@datalad.org>
 contributors: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
 dc:conformsTo: http://docs.datalad.org/metadata.html#v0-1, http://specs.frictionlessdata.io/data-packages
 dc:hasPart: id=031991c8-7ed7-11e6-a607-002590f97d84, id=85c4465e-7aea-11e6-a5d5-002590f97d84, id=9183b182-7aea-11e6-8706-002590f97d84
 dc:isPartOf: 6d69ca68-7e85-11e6-904c-002590f97d84
 dc:modified: 2016-09-20T10:41:31-04:00
 homepage: http://datasets.datalad.org/?dir=/dicoms
 id: 5500090e-7aea-11e6-b268-002590f97d84
 keywords: DICOM, NeuroImaging
 license: http://opendatacommons.org/licenses/pddl/
 name: dicoms
 schema:availableFrom: id=940086d9-bff2-457d-9cf1-bebfa382ed33, id=f3a1b935-41d9-426e-8f7e-d44919d9630e, id=f8cccf6e-59d8-4178-84f2-48fb328c9e78
 title: Various collections of DICOM files which could be used for software and methods testing
 type: Dataset
 version: 83ff4c3b0aeb3b75680bf3888d7ce12546450978
dicoms:
 id: a01b98a6-7f43-11e6-97ff-8019340ce7f2
 location: dicoms
 type: Dataset
changes on filesystem:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
 openfmri | 0

$> grep -r a01b98a6-7f43-11e6-97ff-8019340ce7f2 .

$> git grep 5500090e-7aea-11e6-b268-002590f97d84 
.datalad/meta/dicoms/meta.json:    "@id": "5500090e-7aea-11e6-b268-002590f97d84",
.datalad/meta/dicoms/meta.json:    "@id": "5500090e-7aea-11e6-b268-002590f97d84",
.datalad/meta/dicoms/meta.json:    "dcterms:isPartOf": "5500090e-7aea-11e6-b268-002590f97d84",
.datalad/meta/dicoms/meta.json:    "dcterms:isPartOf": "5500090e-7aea-11e6-b268-002590f97d84",
.datalad/meta/dicoms/meta.json:    "dcterms:isPartOf": "5500090e-7aea-11e6-b268-002590f97d84",
```

so I guess it is still breeds those ids...   Please try @mih and see if you observe the same
